author: Eltiempo.es IA
title: Cierre temporal en Punto de Nieve Santa Inés debido a la falta de nieve
text:
Cierre temporal en Punto de Nieve Santa Inés debido a la falta de nieve
La estación permanece cerrada con un espesor de nieve de 0 cm y sin pistas abiertas.
Eltiempo.es IA
Parte de nieve en la estación Punto de Nieve Santa Inés
La estación de Punto de Nieve Santa Inés se encuentra actualmente cerrada debido a la ausencia de nieve, con un espesor que varía entre 0 cm en sus cotas mínimas y máximas. A pesar de contar con nieve tipo polvo, no hay pistas ni remontes abiertos, lo que limita las actividades de esquí. Sin embargo, los visitantes pueden disfrutar de otras actividades como el snowpark, esquí de fondo, raquetas y trineos.
Evolución del tiempo en la estación Punto de Nieve Santa Inés en los próximos días
Para hoy, se espera una temperatura máxima de 5°C y una mínima de -3°C en las cotas más bajas, con una probabilidad de precipitación del 20%. La sensación térmica puede descender a -5°C debido a rachas de viento de hasta 15 km/h. La visibilidad será buena, con una radiación UV moderada.
En las cotas más altas, las temperaturas oscilarán entre 3°C y -5°C, con una probabilidad de precipitación del 25%. La sensación térmica podría ser más fría, alcanzando -7°C, con vientos de hasta 20 km/h.
Mañana, las condiciones serán similares, con una ligera disminución de las temperaturas, alcanzando máximas de 4°C y mínimas de -4°C en las cotas bajas. La probabilidad de precipitación aumentará al 30%, mientras que la sensación térmica podría ser de -6°C con vientos de 18 km/h.
En las cotas altas, las temperaturas variarán entre 2°C y -6°C, con una probabilidad de precipitación del 35%. El viento podría intensificarse, alcanzando 22 km/h, lo que afectará la sensación térmica, llevándola a -8°C.
Pasado mañana, se prevé un ligero aumento de la temperatura en las cotas bajas, con máximas de 6°C y mínimas de -2°C. La probabilidad de precipitación disminuirá al 15%, con una sensación térmica de -4°C y vientos de 12 km/h.
En las cotas altas, las temperaturas oscilarán entre 4°C y -4°C, con una probabilidad de precipitación del 20%. El viento se mantendrá en 15 km/h, afectando la sensación térmica a -6°C.
Consejos y precauciones
Dado el cierre de la estación y las condiciones meteorológicas, se recomienda a los visitantes planificar sus actividades alternativas y estar atentos a las actualizaciones del clima. Es importante llevar ropa adecuada para el frío y protegerse del viento.
Para más información actualizada sobre las condiciones de nieve y el clima, visite la Sección de Esquí de Eltiempo.es.

author: Syndicated Content
title: Former Hong Kong independence group leader seeks asylum in Britain
text:
By Kanishka Singh
WASHINGTON (Reuters) – The former leader of a Hong Kong pro-independence group, who was sentenced under a national security law imposed by China, fled to Britain and will seek asylum over there, he told the Washington Post.
WHY IT IS IMPORTANT
In November 2021, Tony Chung, who was then 20, was sentenced to 43 months in prison for trying to separate the city from China, and for money laundering. Chung was charged with secession under the sweeping national security law in 2020 and denied bail.
Beijing imposed the national security law on the Asian financial hub in 2020 after months of anti-government protests. The law punishes acts including subversion, secession, collusion with foreign forces, and extremism with up to life in prison.
KEY QUOTES
The trauma of detention and continued surveillance left Chung with a feeling of “immense pressure and fear,” compelling him to leave, he told the newspaper.
Chung also said he was made to take part in a compulsory “deradicalization” program in detention.
Guards “kept telling us (him and others in prison) that the United States government is really bad and that we had been manipulated by the United States,” Chung was quoted as saying. “We felt like we had to agree with them, that we couldn’t disagree or argue back.”
Chung was eventually released in June 2023 after his time was reduced for good behavior, according to the Washington Post. He plans to continue his studies and told the Post he will contribute everything he can in exile, “just as before.”
CONTEXT
Chung is the former leader of Hong Kong pro-independence group Studentlocalism that dissolved in 2020 before the security law came into effect.
Prosecutors had said at the time he was charged that he acted as an administrator for the Facebook pages of the U.S. branch of Studentlocalism and an organization called the Initiative Independence Party. They also said pro-independence T-shirts, flags and books were seized from his home.
The former British colony returned to Chinese rule in 1997 with the promise of a high degree of autonomy. Democracy activists and some Western governments say China broke that promise, an allegation that Beijing denies.
(Reporting by Kanishka Singh in Washington; Editing by David Gregorio)

author: MENAFN
title: 'There's So Much Of Us In This Novel', Union Minister Hardeep Puri Told Wife Lakshmi On Her Debut Fiction | MENAFN.COM
text: New Delhi, 14 March (IANS) While she wears many hats, and many addresses befit her, what do we call her? Mrs Puri or Ambassador Puri?“Lakshmi", she insists, as she shares the stories behind the theme of her debut novel, 'Swallowing The Sun'. A top diplomat, gender rights advocate, the wife of a Union Minister, and a daughter to the parents who made her all that and more, Lakshmi Murdeshwar Puri launched her first fiction 'Swallowing the Sun' (Aleph) earlier this year with much fanfare. But on Thursday evening, during a close and cozy gathering in the national capital, it was all about her and the stories she lived to create 'Swallowing the Sun'. The story, a historical fiction, is in many ways contemporary and forward-looking. This“coming of age” story of Malti, who is ahead of her times, is the thread of this“feminist” work. Education being an instrument for neutralising gender disparities, pursuing that on the eve of Independence was tantamount to taking part in a revolution to not subject a girl to child marriage and child motherhood, and make her identity secondary to the roles she did not choose to play. Lakshmi is a living example of this "revolution". And her story is the story of“sheroes”, her protagonist that explores heroism in her time and space. Raised in an intellectually stimulating household, Lakshmi delighted in her mother's storytelling and her“restrained” father's poetry. “We lived in poetry,” she said. With plentiful engagement and indulgence in poetry and literature, it was only too natural for her to have a flair for storytelling. Sparing a thought to the nearly extinct art of exchanging letters, which is largely the means of communication between the lovers in the story, the author seems to be fancying the idea of a book based only on letters. It was an editorial decision to cut down the number of letters in the novel that Lakshmi had to make peace with. Reading excerpts from the book where an angry Malti signs off to her lover with“Yours' sincerely", instead of“Yours' affectionately", was a reminder of how powerfully emotive letters could be. When Lakshmi finished writing the book, it was her husband, Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas and Housing and Urban Affairs, Hardeep Singh Puri, who first read the manuscript and said to his wife:“There is so much of us in this novel.” (Kavya Dubey may be reached at ...) MENAFN14032024000231011071ID1107978466 Legal Disclaimer: MENAFN provides the information “as is” without warranty of any kind. author: PTI
title: Born in village in undivided India, Manmohan Singh often spoke of communal harmony
text:
New Delhi: Born in a village in undivided Punjab, now in Pakistan, former prime minister Manmohan Singh's family witnessed first-hand the tragic Partition and he often spoke of communal harmony in his long public life.

.

Singh, the architect of India's economic reforms, died here on Thursday night. He was 92.

.

He was born in Gah in Punjab province's western region, which now falls in Pakistan.

.

Singh was a noted economist and a respected figure in India and abroad.

.3 Motilal Nehru Road bungalow: Ex-PM Manmohan Singh's post-retirement abode for 10 yrs.

According to his profile on the website pmindia.gov, \"Dr Singh completed his matriculation examinations from the Punjab University in 1948. His academic career took him from Punjab to the University of Cambridge, UK, where he earned a First Class Honours degree in Economics in 1957.\" Singh followed this with a D.Phil in Economics from Nuffield College at Oxford University in 1962.

.

His book, 'India's Export Trends and Prospects for Self-Sustained Growth' was an \"early critique of India's inward-oriented trade policy\

author: Climatempo
title: Perigo: forte frente fria aumenta risco no Rio de Janeiro | Climatempo
text: Oferecido por A chegada de uma nova e grande frente fria no decorrer desta sexta-feira (22) em alto mar na altura do litoral do Sudeste, irá provocar muita chuva no estado do [Rio De Janeiro](/previsao-do-tempo/cidade/321/riodejaneiro-rj). Todas as regiões fluminenses ficam em ALERTA até o final de semana. Os volumes de chuva podem ultrapassar a média histórica! Entre a sexta-feira (22) e o sábado (23), a frente fria se desloca lentamente sobre o estado e provoca chuva frequente/persistente, por vezes forte, com taxas horárias muito elevadas. Isso irá acarretar acumulados extremamente elevados, que podem superar o volume médio para TODO O MÊS DE MARÇO em apenas 24h/48 horas. Confira abaixo a lista de cidades com maiores acumulados previstos entre a sexta-feira (22) e o domingo, 24 de março - total de chuva de 3 dias: Região metropolitana do Rio de Janeiro: 240mm Angra dos Reis: 280mm Petrópolis: 500mm Maricá: 230mm Resende: 160mm Paraty: 280mm Vassouras: 280mm Cordeiro: 300mm Xerém: 450mm Silva Jardim: 230mm Itaperuna: 180mm Campos dos Goytacazes: 180mm Foto: Getty Images No domingo (24), a frente fria se afasta e a chuva diminui, mas não para, o que poderá agravar os problemas no estado. Os modelos de previsão meteorológica indicam que os acumulados de chuva no estado, de forma geral, fiquem entre 150 e 300mm. Mas em algumas áreas, sobretudo na Baixada Fluminense e na região serrana, os acumulados serão da ordem de 300 a 500 mm (volumes médios na região, não descartando que pontualmente esses valores possam ser ultrapassados). A Climatempo ALERTA para o alto risco de transbordamento de rios e deslizamentos de terra, além de enchentes e enxurradas.

author: Mayo Clinic
title: Type 2 diabetes no longer a barrier to becoming a living kidney donor
text: [Mayo Clinic](/user/mayo-clinic)on Thu, 02/29/2024 - 14:18 ROCHESTER, Minn. — People who are overall healthy and living with well-controlled Type 2 diabetes can donate a kidney, thanks to a change in national policy. Share this: ROCHESTER, Minn. — People who are overall healthy and living with well-controlled Type 2 diabetes can donate a kidney, thanks to a change in national policy. The [Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network](https://www.mayoclinic.org/biographies/issa-naim-s-m-d/bio-20235178?mc_id=us&utm_source=newsnetwork&utm_medium=l&utm_content=content&utm_campaign=mayoclinic&geo=national&placementsite=enterprise&invsrc=other&cauid=100721) updated its [living donor criteria](https://optn.transplant.hrsa.gov/media/d2hlvxv1/policy-notice_modify-ld-excl-crit_ldc.pdf) . It makes some people with Type 2 diabetes eligible to donate a kidney. This marks a "significant shift" in criteria for living kidney donors, says [Naim Issa, M.D.](https://www.mayoclinic.org/biographies/issa-naim-s-m-d/bio-20235178) , Mayo Clinic transplant nephrologist. "This policy change may offer a lifeline to some people with end-stage kidney disease, providing them with a better chance for a successful transplant and improved quality of life," he says. Nearly 89,000 people in the U.S. are on the waiting list for a potentially lifesaving kidney transplant, according to the [United Network for Organ Sharing](https://unos.org/data/) . The average wait for a kidney from a deceased donor is three to five years. People who receive kidneys from living donors also tend to have better outcomes, says [Shennen Mao, M.D.](https://www.mayoclinic.org/biographies/mao-shennen-a-m-d/bio-20439463?mc_id=us&utm_source=newsnetwork&utm_medium=l&utm_content=content&utm_campaign=mayoclinic&geo=national&placementsite=enterprise&invsrc=other&cauid=100721) , Mayo Clinic transplant surgeon. "People in need of a kidney transplant typically receive a living donor transplant much faster than a deceased donor transplant, avoiding many years of dialysis and its associated complications," Dr. Mao says. "On average, kidneys from living donors also last longer than those from deceased donors." What led to policy change? Historically, people with diabetes have been prohibited from being living kidney donors because diabetes can [cause kidney disease.](https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/diabetic-nephropathy/diagnosis-treatment/drc-20354562?mc_id=us&utm_source=newsnetwork&utm_medium=l&utm_content=content&utm_campaign=mayoclinic&geo=national&placementsite=enterprise&invsrc=other&cauid=100721) People with Type 1 diabetes remain ineligible to be a living kidney donor. By expanding eligibility criteria, there's potential to save more lives through increased kidney availability while maintaining a commitment to the safety and well-being of donors. What is the policy? The national policy allows people with Type 2 diabetes to donate a kidney if there is no evidence of organ damage or an unacceptable lifetime risk of complications. Mayo Clinic Transplant Center adopted its own more stringent policies to minimize potential risks for the donor. In addition to national criteria, Mayo Clinic patients with Type 2 diabetes also must meet the following criteria to be a donor: - Be age 60 or older. - Have well-controlled diabetes and not use insulin. - If over age 65, can be using up to two oral medications for diabetes. - Not be overweight. - Have no family history of kidney disease. - Undergo a rigorous health assessment and individualized risk evaluation. "Mayo Clinic donors undergo thorough health evaluations and risk assessments, ensuring that only those with minimal risk of complications are approved to donate," says [Pooja Budhiraja, M.B.B.S.](https://www.mayoclinic.org/biographies/budhiraja-pooja-m-b-b-s/bio-20486288?mc_id=us&utm_source=newsnetwork&utm_medium=l&utm_content=content&utm_campaign=mayoclinic&geo=national&placementsite=enterprise&invsrc=other&cauid=100721) , Mayo Clinic nephrologist. "Criteria such as age limits, weight requirements and the absence of a family history of kidney disease help mitigate the long-term health risks for donors. Our commitment is to safeguard donor health while expanding transplant possibilities." Mayo Clinic will also conduct ongoing research to monitor and assess the effect of these policy changes on the long-term outcomes of older living kidney donors with Type 2 diabetes. [Mayo Clinic Transplant Center](https://www.mayoclinic.org/departments-centers/transplant-center/home/orc-20203891?mc_id=us&utm_source=newsnetwork&utm_medium=l&utm_content=content&utm_campaign=mayoclinic&geo=national&placementsite=enterprise&invsrc=other&cauid=100721) is the largest integrated transplant center in the U.S. Learn more about becoming a [living kidney donor](https://www.mayoclinic.org/departments-centers/living-donor-transplantation/overview/ovc-20545462?mc_id=us&utm_source=newsnetwork&utm_medium=l&utm_content=content&utm_campaign=mayoclinic&geo=national&placementsite=enterprise&invsrc=other&cauid=100721) . [Watch: Mayo Clinic Minute: Expanding the living kidney donor pool to those with Type 2 diabetes](https://newsnetwork.mayoclinic.org/discussion/mayo-clinic-minute-expanding-the-living-kidney-donor-pool-to-those-with-type-2-diabetes/?mc_id=us&utm_source=newsnetwork&utm_medium=l&utm_content=content&utm_campaign=mayoclinic&geo=national&placementsite=enterprise&invsrc=other&cauid=100721) Journalists: Broadcast-quality video pkg (1:08) is in the downloads at the end of the post. Please "Courtesy: Mayo Clinic News Network." Read the [script](https://newsnetwork.mayoclinic.org/n7-mcnn/7bcc9724adf7b803/uploads/2024/02/SCRIPT-MCM-Diabetes-and-kidney-transplants.pdf?mc_id=us&utm_source=newsnetwork&utm_medium=l&utm_content=content&utm_campaign=mayoclinic&geo=national&placementsite=enterprise&invsrc=other&cauid=100721) . ### About Mayo Clinic [Mayo Clinic](https://www.mayoclinic.org/about-mayo-clinic?mc_id=us&utm_source=newsnetwork&utm_medium=l&utm_content=content&utm_campaign=mayoclinic&geo=national&placementsite=enterprise&invsrc=other&cauid=100721) is a nonprofit organization committed to innovation in clinical practice, education and research, and providing compassion, expertise and answers to everyone who needs healing. Visit the [Mayo Clinic News Network](https://newsnetwork.mayoclinic.org/?mc_id=us&utm_source=newsnetwork&utm_medium=l&utm_content=content&utm_campaign=mayoclinic&geo=national&placementsite=enterprise&invsrc=other&cauid=100721) for additional Mayo Clinic news. Media contact: - Heather Carlson Kehren, Mayo Clinic Communications, [newsbureau@mayo.edu](mailto:newsbureau@mayo.edu) Share this: Related articles With more than 90,000 people in the U.S. awaiting kidney transplants, the demand exceeds the available supply — emphasizing the critical importance of identifying safeRead more Lisa Brown, 53, of Jacksonville, suffered from severe pelvis and back pain for years. She later learned that her bladder wasn't working due to follicularRead more The Duffer family’s home is filled with lots of love this Valentine’s Day. They have a new baby girl, and dad got the lifesaving heartRead more

author: world today news
title: Boston Dynamics and Toyota Research Institute Partner to Advance Humanoid Robotics
text:
Boston Dynamics y Toyota Research Institute ( TRI ) announced a new alliance to advance the development of humanoid robots by incorporating advanced artificial intelligence and cutting-edge robotic platforms. The main objective of this collaboration is to accelerate progress in general-purpose robotics and offer innovative solutions that improve people’s lives in everyday and industrial activities.
The technology partnership of Boston Dynamics and Toyota Research Institute This partnership lies in uniting the robot Atlas of Boston Dynamics known for its ability to perform complex tasks with extreme mobility, with large-scale behavioral models ( LBM ) from TRI, designed to improve the physical intelligence of robots. The integration of these technologies would allow explore new capabilities in humanoid robots especially in bimanual manipulation and the performance of complex physical tasks.
Robert Playter, CEO de Boston Dynamics highlighted the impact of this alliance: “ We are excited to work together with TRI to tackle the most complex challenges in robotics. Our Atlas robot , together with TRI’s artificial intelligence, will allow us to develop new skills in robots that could revolutionize several sectors ”.
For his part, Gill Pratt, executive director of Toyota Research Institute highlighted the importance of implementing cutting-edge AI in highly advanced robots: “ We are at a key moment where artificial intelligence and robotics converge. Our collaboration with Boston Dynamics will allow us to amplify human capacity, improving both safety and quality of life through advanced automation ”.
Both companies have led the field of robotics in their respective areas. Boston Dynamics is recognized for its innovative Atlas humanoid platform, which has been developed to perform tasks that imitate human behavior with precision and efficiency. On the other hand, TRI has advanced applied AI, especially in multitasking model creation conditioned by vision and language, which allow robots to perform complex manipulations.
The project will focus on collecting data from the physical tasks performed by robots, to then train more advanced behavioral models. These models will be used to equip the humanoid robots with robust and agile abilities ready to be deployed in industrial and everyday environments.
This alliance represents an important step in the future of humanoid robotics, with implications for multiple industries, from manufacturing to healthcare. With the merger of Boston Dynamics and TRI, humanoid robots are expected to be able to perform tasks that previously seemed beyond the reach of machines, providing practical and effective solutions to improve human life.
